item.title: 据说壳牌正在研究收购的好处，英国石油公司（BP）股价上涨

item.description: 比尔-阿克曼（Bill Ackman）对母校哈佛大学如何处理与唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的冲突提出了一系列担忧，认为哈佛大学需要更换董事会领导层。【原文：Bill Ackman rattled off a list of concerns over how his alma mater Harvard University has handled the conflict with President Donald Trump, arguing it needs a change in board leadership.】

item.title: 随着关税、人工智能和服务业的动荡，苹果走到了关键时刻
item.description: 苹果公司正面临最艰难的时期之一，因为它要应对关税威胁、供应链挑战、人工智能斗争以及服务业务的潜在动荡。另外：该公司在中国推出的人工智能很可能是 iOS 18.6 的一部分，苹果的音乐和全球事务团队进行了重组，飞行出租车初创公司 Archer 聘请了一位新的人工智能主管。【原文：Apple is facing one of its toughest periods yet as it copes with the threat of tariffs, supply chain challenges, AI struggles and potential turmoil in its services business. Also: The company’s China AI launch will likely be part of iOS 18.6, reorganizations extend to Apple’s music and global affairs teams, and flying taxi startup Archer hires a new head of AI.】

item.title: 巴菲特对贸易协议的看法
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）在周末宣布他 94 岁退休后说的最中肯的话不是他对肆虐全球经济的关税的看法（他并不赞成），而是他对伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）3500 亿美元现金的辩护。他说，这是他恪守原则的结果，即只投资于能提供有意义回报的交易，而他认为最近这样的交易并不多。【原文：The most pertinent thing Warren Buffett said at the weekend beyond announcing his retirement at age 94 wasn’t his thoughts on the tariffs roiling the global economy (he’s not a fan) but his defense of Berkshire Hathaway’s $350 billion cash pile. It was, he said, a consequence of abiding by his principle to invest only in deals that offered meaningful returns and his view there had not been many lately.】

item.title: 马来西亚寻求在谈判中将美国征收的关税降至零
